I'm sad, and not suprised, that this game is on the pirate bay.  If there's anyone here who can afford it, this is one of those rare games that you should pay for.  

If anything, at least try it first to see if you'll like it (you will) and then donate the author whatever change you can spare (he takes donations).  It's just that good.

I have the crack that was posted in a comment.
When I click UDK in win32, it says "program can't start because XINPUT1_3.dll is missing from your computer"

Windows 7 Ultimate, worked for me right away. Just copy the files elsewhere, if you place it in program files, run as admin. RUN AS ADMIN, I cannot stress this enough.

This game works. If it doesn;t work for you, run UDK setup, then run udk.exe (The game).
Comment on closing the process, force-kill. I cannot seem to find a quit anywhere.

@autastic; it's the door labelled "exit" on one of the four walls in the main menu.

@pidgeongrape that error is usually the result of your DirectX not being up to date, try updating directx from microsoft's end-user runtime installer.
Works fine, but why the fuck is there a time limit? Completely ruins the whole game for me
after the unreal logo plays, game crashes with "UDK.exe has stopped working" error.  Tried with and without crack.  Any ideas?
@Rikeus the time limit was only present in the screener version of the game given to reviewers; perhaps that is what the crack is for?
everyone who is saying they fixed the crash did so with nvidia drivers... but I'm using an ATI card! (HD 5770), with the newest 13.1 drivers!

okay I got it working, apparently those are drivers for nvidia PhysX and work just fine on an AMD card.

@Rikeus, ignore the time limit.  You can keep playing the game when it runs out.  Nobody's quite sure what it is there for, but it is definitely not the same "game-ending" time limit that was there in the screener version.
"Live by your own clock, not someone else's."

Addressing comments about this game from earlier, I don't think a single bit of the game is broken due to piracy. No screamers, I've been able to solve the puzzles, the advice panels work and everything.

And run as admin if you have it in a place where it's necessary, otherwise game will not save.

Oh, I got it. Just used the startup parameter "-windowed", it loads the unreal engine clip in windowed mode, then the rest is regular full screen.
Also, this game is insane. Some House of Leaves-tier shit.

If you keep getting .dll errors when trying to launch, just go to AntichamberBinariesRedistDirectX and run DXSETUP. Worked for me.

Also to quit, to hold esc.

To exit the game simply hold the ESC key, these instructions are written on the wall in the antechamber.

When I first installed it it worked fine. But now when I start the UDK application in Win32 i get a working symbol for a couple of seconds and then nothing. Like it crashes before it starts. So after looking around I found the launch logs and it has this fatal error when starting the game

Log: === Critical error: ===
Fatal error!

Address = 0x525c8e   (filename not found) [in C:Program Files (x86)antichamberWin32UDK.exe]

I look in Win32 and I do see a UDK.exe file below the UDK application.

Any thoughts on how to fix this?
If you're getting a black-screen after the unreal logo try Crtl+Esc as soon as you see the logo, wait about 15-30 sec, then open the game back up....
